thread.title: Wasserman Schultz on Rising Obamacare Costs: ‘There Are People Who Always Complain Health Care Is too Expensive’
thread.title_full: Wasserman Schultz on Rising Obamacare Costs: ‘There Are People Who Always Complain Health Care Is too Expensive’

author: Chandler Gill
title: Wasserman Schultz on Rising Obamacare Costs: ‘There Are People Who Always Complain Health Care Is too Expensive’
text:
Rep. Debbie Wasserman Schultz (D., Fla.) on Thursday defended rising costs under Obamacare, telling CNN's Alisyn Camerota there will always be people who "complain" that health care is too expensive.
Camerota said that insurance companies have pulled out of the Affordable Care Act's exchanges in Florida because it is too expensive, giving residents less health care options under the law.
"You have had some of the basic providers, insurance companies pulling out, but really, you haven't heard–" Camerota said before Wasserman Schultz cut in.
"We still have a choice," said Wasserman Schultz, former chair of the Democratic National Committee.
Camerota then ask if her constituents have lodged any complaints about the increase in costs.
"You haven't heard from any constituents who say this is getting too expensive?" Camerota asked.
Wasserman Schultz responded that there are people "who always complain" about health insurance being too expensive, even under Obamacare.
"There are people who always complain that health care is too expensive," she said.
The post Wasserman Schultz on Rising Obamacare Costs: ‘There Are People Who Always Complain Health Care Is too Expensive’ appeared first on Washington Free Beacon .
